contexts.context: ...– as F writes – that the Pope will <mark>oppose</mark> (Francis I) as soon as he becomes aware...
...Siena, Parma and Piacenza. He is therefore <mark>opposed</mark> to the plans put forward by Pier Luigi,...
...bring it under F's rule. 37. Perhaps K's <mark>opposed</mark> counselors can be persuaded by promises. 38. More...
